#labels Phase-Deploy
How to install the spell checker for Unified Southern Quechua


 # download spellChecker.tar from [http://code.google.com/p/squoia/downloads/list]
 # unpack the archive:
{{{
$ tar xf spellChecker.tar
}}}
 # get foma:
  * either the newest version from here:
     [http://code.google.com/p/foma/downloads/list]
  * or per svn checkout:
{{{
$ svn co http://foma.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/foma/ foma
}}}
 # compile and install foma:
{{{
$ cd path-to-your-foma-sources
$ make
$ make install
}}}
 # compile fmed.c and copy it to some place in your PATH, e.g. /usr/local/bin:
{{{
$ cd path-to-your-spellchecker-source/foma_files
$ gcc -o fmed fmed.c -lfoma /usr/local/lib/libfoma.a  -lz 
}}}
   or do (depending on where your libfoma.a is):
{{{
$ gcc -o fmed fmed.c -lfoma /usr/lib/libfoma.a  -lz 
$ cp fmed /usr/local/bin
}}}
 # compile the finite state transducers (compiling the normalizers will take a while due to large lexica):
{{{
$ cd path-to-spellChecker/analyzer
$ foma -f compile.foma  
$ cd ../normalizer
$ foma -f chain.foma
}}}
 # you should now have the binary files 
   * analyzer/analyzeUnificado.bin
   * analyzer/spellcheckUnificado.bin
   * normalizer/chain.bin
 # adapt the paths in spellcheck-example.sh, save the file as spellcheck.sh and make it executable like this:
{{{
$ chmod +x spellcheck.sh
}}}
 # the tokenizer needs the Uplug::PreProcess::Tokenizer perl module:
   * get from [http://search.cpan.org/~tiedemann/uplug-main-0.3.8/lib/Uplug/PreProcess/Tokenizer.pm]
   * or install it through cpan:
{{{
$ cpan Uplug::PreProcess::Tokenizer
}}}
 # now you can run spellcheck.sh, pass the text you want to spell check as argument
{{{
$ ./spellcheck.sh file-you-want-to-spell-check
}}}
 the script will output a list of misspelled words with their corrections, or 'no spelling errors found' if the text is written according to the Unified Southern orthography. The list is also printed to tmp/text.out.
